citation.article-title: Succinatimonas hippei gen. nov., sp. nov., isolated from human faeces
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Succinatimonas [Suc.ci.na.ti.moâ€²nas. N.L. n. succinas -atis succinate; L. fem. n. monas a unit, monad; N.L. fem. n. Succinatimonas succinate-(producing) monad].
Cells are Gram-negative, strictly anaerobic, non-spore-forming rods.
They are non-motile, non-spiral rods without flagella, negative for catalase, oxidase, urease, indole production, nitrate reduction and hydrolysis of aesculin and gelatin.
Utilize a small number of sugars and produce succinate and acetate as major fermentation end products from glucose.
The type species is Succinatimonas hippei.
